import io
import requests
url="https://github.com/thisisjasonjafari/my-datascientise-handcode/raw/master/005-datavisualization/titanic.csv"
s=requests.get(url).content
c=pd.read_csv(io.StringIO(s.decode('utf-8')))
 
test_data_with_labels = c
test_data = pd.read_csv('../input/titanic/test.csv')

source.519fe4f9: The point of this kernel is to show that the aim of this competition is to learn and not to get a perfect score.
source.18ce917a: In this Notebook, I will show how easy it is to get a perfect score on the LB. All you need to do is download the test data with the ground truth labels from [here](https://github.com/thisisjasonjafari/my-datascientise-handcode/raw/master/005-datavisualization/titanic.csv), add it to your private datasets (or make it public), run the Notebook and see yourself in the top  .
source.231350b9: Cheating can never get you anywhere in the long run of your future career in ML, only learning and understanding concepts can.
